title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned after opting out of his Red Sox contract following a strong 2025 season.
Giolito's 2025 performance included a 3.41 ERA and a 10-4 record, prompting him to seek better offers.
The Red Sox have bolstered their rotation with Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, reducing chances of Giolito's return.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr. is a potential trade target for the Patriots due to his high salary and team dynamics.
Jaguars OL Walker Little could interest the Patriots, given their need for offensive line improvements despite his recent struggles.
Seahawks EDGE Uchenna Nwosu, with a $20.7 million cap hit, is a possible target as Patriots seek defensive reinforcements.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum confirmed he has no set return date after participating in five-on-five scrimmages post-Achilles injury.
Celtics' photos suggest Tatum's increased practice involvement, but he stresses cautious progression to full recovery.
Celtics prioritize Tatum reaching 100% health before return; broadcaster changes fuel speculation on potential return dates.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC's Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko received praise for their coverage of Team USA's overtime win in women's hockey.
Broadcasters Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir allowed Alysa Liu's gold-medal figure skating to shine by limiting commentary.
NBC Sports' restraint and focus on key moments enhanced the viewing experience during the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston will fund free rides on MBTA routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using remaining pandemic relief funds.
The fare-free program, benefiting Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury since 2022, was initially funded with $8 million from federal relief.
Mayor Wu is discussing long-term funding options with the MBTA as program's future beyond June remains uncertain.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported highest snow totals with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches as of 7 a.m. February 21.
Essex County towns Haverhill and Methuen recorded significant snowfall, receiving 5 inches and 4.6 inches respectively.
Meteorologists predict a high impact snowstorm with blizzard conditions and possible power outages Sunday night into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa has been inspired by her coworker Annie, who has run the marathon 24 times and serves as her coach.
She expresses gratitude for the physical and mental lessons gained from preparing for the marathon on April 20, 2026.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac of Pembroke, NH, sentenced to 15 months for using over $1M in COVID relief to buy a golf course.
Kirouac secured more than $1M in EIDL funds through the CARES Act, intended for business expenses during the pandemic.
Despite already selling HK Hudson, Kirouac received additional funds and misled authorities about the pending sale.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with multiple thefts at high-end Back Bay stores, faces charges of larceny and drug possession.
Cutelis allegedly stole over $10,000 in merchandise from Lululemon and Ralph Lauren stores on Newbury Street and Prudential Center.
Bail set at $2,500; Cutelis also held on a fugitive charge for failing to appear in Brentwood, New Hampshire.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora confirmed Roman Anthony will be the leadoff hitter for the 2026 season.
In 2025, Anthony recorded a .320 batting average and .930 OPS in 27 leadoff appearances.
The expected lineup includes Willson Contreras cleanup, with Trevor Story, Jarren Duran, or Wilyer Abreu likely batting second and third.
